abstract: The Bear Stearns Companies said Monday that its profit dropped 79 percent in the first quarter, which ended just two weeks before speculation about a liquidity crisis forced its sale to JPMorgan Chase.
lead_paragraph: The Bear Stearns Companies said Monday that its profit dropped 79 percent in the first quarter, which ended just two weeks before speculation about a liquidity crisis forced its sale to JPMorgan Chase.

headline.main: First-Quarter Earnings Dropped 79% at Bear Stearns

abstract: Bear Stearns Chief Executive Alan D. Schwartz, who found himself selling the hobbled investment bank to JPMorgan Chase in his eleventh week on the job, has been invited to stay on as a senior dealmaker, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Bear Stearns Chief Executive Alan D. Schwartz, who found himself selling the hobbled investment bank to JPMorgan Chase in his eleventh week on the job, has been invited to stay on as a senior dealmaker, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Bear’s Chief in Line for Rainmaker Role, Report Says
